column1: What are we looking for?

Remotely collaborate with operations staff at the plant to fix issues with the highest efficiency possible
Lead weekly performance meetings to review fixed problems
Use big data tools to automate and improve processes that impact the operating plants
What specific knowledge do you require?
Minimum of 5 years of experience with knowledge in big data analytics and O&M preferably in the energy sector.
Bachelor of Data Science or Engineering degree
Advanced knowledge of Python programming and big data tools.

column1: Analytics Visualisation Analyst;{'name': 'Cargill'
Want to build a stronger
column2: more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160
column3: 000 employees who are committed to safe
column4: responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s food ingredients and bio-industrial business
column5: where we anticipate trends around taste
column6: nutrition and safety to innovate and provide solutions to manufacturers

column1: Job Purpose and Impact

The Analytics Visualisation Analyst will develop an in depth understanding of the business to innovate significant data driven insights to help business leaders make better decisions and will develop and combine subject matter expertise in key data domains. In this role
column2: you will act as a partner with internal stakeholders and technical staff to execute a business technology strategy that delivers reporting and analytics solutions.

column1: You will be designing and building these strategic and actionable insights utilizing the comprehensive visual analytics capabilities
column2: connecting to the underlying data models in our Big Data Platform. In this role
column3: you will act as an authority for key metrics and KPI’s
column7: and storytelling across functions and regions. The insights will drive value for the Cargill FIBI business and help the business make fact-based decisions
column8: and become an insight driven organization.

column1: We are looking for a candidate with proven data analytics experience utilizing data analysis methodologies and tools to increase efficiency and effectiveness. This role requires strong technical skills
column2: curiosity to learn new business processes

column1: Key Accountabilities
Identify and analyze business needs
column2: gather requirements and define the scope and objectives to drive business decisions.

column1: Prepare data and explore new potential data to support reporting and analysis initiatives.
Prepare reports and analysis to identify
column2: analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets for values and new opportunities.

column1: Lead analysis in collaboration with process and operations leadership to identify the top opportunities for improvement and track progress and impact on future results.
Mentor and coach peers and recommend process improvements related to delivery and new methodologies.
Partner with the team to develop a detailed understanding of the business and offer mentorship or technical solutions to identify business problems.
You will work under minimal supervision and independently handle complex issues while referring only the most complex issues to higher-level staff.
Build prototypes to test new concepts and be a key contributor of ideas that improve fact-based decision making
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Minimum of four years of related work experience
Business acumen and the ability to partner and communicate effectively with business counterparts
3+ years applied experience in working with Visual Analytics Platforms like Tableau and/or PowerBI
2+ years applied experience in optimizing performance of dashboards (front-end) to accommodate for non-functional requirements
Supported and enabled management information and business intelligence strategy
Applied experience with UI/UX concepts and story-telling through data
Applied experience with data process mapping and business analysis
Fluent English is mandatory
Preferred Qualifications
Certification in programming language or business intelligence tools
Confirmed skills querying relational databases with query language
Confirmed experience working with large data stores
Applied experience with Data Warehousing concepts (e.g. dimensional modelling) and the use of traditional RDBMS;
Experience with the Agile mindset
Experience with Alteryx
Experience with SAP Business Objects
Experience in Diagnostic & Advanced Analytics

column1: Acompanhar

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations
column3: and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings

column1: Get to know our team:

This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. column3: and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science
column6: and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data

column1: Analista de Dados e DataOps;{'name': 'Braskem'

Nessa posição você será responsável por ajudar a Braskem a ser uma empresa mais Data Driven (Decisões de Negócio guiadas por dados). Nosso trabalho está focado em construir pontes e caminhos de dados entre sistemas para que nossas áreas de negócio tomem decisões com base em números
Responsabilidades e Atribuições
Construção e manutenção de motores de ingestão de dados à partir de diversos tipos de formato de dados (dados estruturados / não estruturados / arquivos / estruturas xml ou json / parquet / APIs).
Identificar pontos de melhoria em pipeline de dados
column2: analisando performance e qualidade dos dados.

column1: Desenvolver automações / algoritmos com foco em qualidade de dados
Analisar e identificar possíveis problemas de arquitetura em nuvem para diversos recursos (Data Lake
Desenvolvimento de automações para gestão de mudança / release / deploy (DataOps) de soluções de dados em nuvem.
Estar constantemente em processo de conhecimento e adaptação a novas tecnologias de manipulação e análise de dados.
Requisitos e qualificações
Conhecimentos em melhores práticas de utilização de plataforma de dados em nuvem.
Conhecimentos na plataforma Microsoft Azure
column2: tendo noções sobre recursos como Data Lake

column1: Conhecimentos DevSecOps ou DataOps / CI e CD (Continous Integration e Continous Delivery)

column1: Job Purpose and Impact

The Analytics Data Process Analyst will develop an in depth understanding of the business to innovate significant data driven insights to help business leaders make better decisions and will develop and combine subject matter expertise in key data domains. Our aim is to empower the business to unlock value from data assets
column2: uplift analytical capabilities and support data-driven decision making across the organization. In this role
column3: you will act as a partner with internal stakeholders and technical staff to execute a business technology strategy that delivers reporting and analytics solutions. You will work closely with business teams to help explore how data and analytics solutions can address business needs. Together with business and technical stakeholders at the group
column4: functional and regional level you will co-create and deliver data and analytics solutions.

column1: Key Accountabilities
Identify and analyze business needs
column2: gather requirements and define the scope and objectives to drive business decisions.

column1: Prepare data and explore new potential data to support reporting and analysis initiatives.
Prepare reports and analysis to identify
column2: analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets for values and new opportunities.

column1: Lead analysis in collaboration with process and operations leadership to identify the top opportunities for improvement and track progress and impact on future results.
Mentor and coach peers and recommend process improvements related to delivery and new methodologies.
Partner with the team to develop a detailed understanding of the business and offer mentorship or technical solutions to identify business problems.
You will work under minimal supervision and independently handle complex issues while referring only the most complex issues to higher-level staff.
Help drive the adoption of new data and analytics solutions within our businesses and coach users to analyze and access data via various data and analytics tools.
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Minimum of four years of related work experience
Business acumen and the ability to partner and communicate effectively with business counterparts
Experience in translating business requirements into data solutions
Experience with data analytics tools and applications
Experience in extracting data from databases and other applications
Applied experience with data process mapping and business analysis
Fluent English is mandatory
Preferred Qualifications
Certification in programming language or business intelligence tools
Confirmed skills querying relational databases with query language
Confirmed experience working with large data stores
Experience with the Agile mindset

As a data collector
column2: you enter information into a database and ensure that your data collection sources are accurate. Data collection is the process of gathering and measuring information on variables of interest

column1: The goal of this project is to tap into the collective intelligence of the public at large. column1: Overview
#Locations: Barcelona

PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world famous portfolio of brands are sold every day. Our Data Science & Analytics group influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time
column2: they’ve built new capabilities that have defined the data science roadmap across all of our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.

column1: Join our Data Science team where you will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data
column2: where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models

column1: Data Science Analyst
PepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change
column2: in part driven by emergent retail technologies. To ensure continued success in the food and beverage space
column3: PepsiCo has assembled a dedicated Sales Effectiveness Data Science (SE-DS) Team – tasked with optimizing our sales operations and developing innovative solutions that will give PepsiCo a sustainable competitive advantage. This SE-DS team forms part of the broader global Data Science group within our global Data & Analytics (D+A) organization.

column1: While tied closely to the broader organization
column2: this team can be seen more as a flexible
column3: experimental and execution-focused group; embracing the core values of having bias for action

column4: with the objective of quickly adding value to the business through innovative
column5: quickly executed and often experimental solutions
column6: while always focusing on future global scalability of each solution.

About us:
The Center for Climate Crime Analysis (CCCA) is a non-profit organization founded by prosecutors and law enforcement professionals. We combine the power of law
column2: data and analysis to support allies fighting for climate justice and human rights
column4: and hold accountable those causing the climate crisis.

column1: CCCA works with and strategically supports NGOs
column2: expert organizations and private citizens fighting climate change or human rights violations in their efforts to generate
column3: preserve and collect high quality information. CCCA also conducts legal and forensic analyses of information and prepares concrete case files. These are shared with the competent law enforcement or regulatory authorities
column5: and with private corporations. Our work thus has a force multiplier effect: enhancing the impact of investigations by our partners; and enabling more effective implementation of the enforcement
column6: litigation and advocacy mandates of others. Our current programs focus on combatting illegal deforestation in the Amazon Basin and addressing methane emissions to drive rapid reductions in near-term warming.

column1: About the position:

CCCA is looking for a Data Analysis Associate for its Methane Program. Methane emissions are a crucial piece of the climate puzzle. New data on methane emissions is becoming available and this program seeks to maximize its impact. CCCA will use this data to put pressure on emitters and their enablers (regulators
column3: customers…) through legal action and advocacy. The ideal candidate has substantial expertise in data analysis and excellent communication skills that allow them to contribute to the legal and advocacy strategies at the core of the program by working with technical and non-technical colleagues to understand the questions to be answered and propose solutions.

column1: The Data Analysis Associate will report to the Methane Program Director to develop and implement methodologies and solutions for analysis within the scope of CCCA’s Methane Program.
